intro: Onosma alborosea, commonly known as the white-hairy onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Onosma alborosea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
